ee:message.ee:set-payload: %dw 2.0 import * from dw::core::Arrays output application/json --- { "details1": payload filter ($.status != "UNDEPLOYED") map (item, index) -> { "sl-no": index + 1, "app-name": item.domain, "status": item.status, "workers": item.workers."type".weight, "worker-size": item.workers.amount, "mule-version": item.muleVersion.version, "java-version": item.muleVersion.javaVersion, "isEditing": if ( item.staticIPsEnabled == true and item.status== "UNDEPLOYED" ) "true" else "false" } }
%dw 2.0 output application/json --- { "Message" : if (attributes.statusCode==200) "Updated Successfully!" else "Error", "ok" : true }

ms-aichain:chat-answer-prompt.doc:name: Chat answer prompt
ms-aichain:chat-answer-prompt.ms-aichain:prompt: #[%dw 2.0 output application/java --- "based on the data set provided can you specify if I need to reduce the worker size of my mule application. currently its 0.2 workers size with number of workers as 1. Note that Maximum number workers possible in mule is 8. The worker sizes available are 0.1,0.2,1,2,4,8,16. Use below data set " ++ write(payload, "application/json")]

ee:transform.doc:name: Format Stats to display in JChart
